text:
That's great you're already developing relationship at different studio's. Short contracts can be tiring but it's a good way to let those studios and people know more about you and your work ethic. It might take a while but it will be useful in the future.

Congrats on the work visa, you are correct Montreal and Vancouver are big industry hubs, especially Montreal in the past 2 years. Unfortunately all studios have slowed down drastically on hiring due to the pandemic but hopefully things ease up in the following months. Otherwise getting work here is pretty straightforward with a visa, it's all about the reel!

You can see my latest demo reel on my website: <http://www.mondundu.com|www.mondundu.com>
Almost all of my work is still under Non disclosure Agreement, I'll be updating it later this summer.

That's true! I've never seen the situation from this point of view. You're right, thank you!
Yes the pandemic is a disaster everywhere and in every industry unfortunately. I hope this will pass soon and we'll be back to normal.
I can enter Canada until next February so I hope there will be the chance, it is still quite far for now. :crossed_fingers::skin-tone-3:
Any advices on Vancouver? Really any haha! For example I know that in Montr√©al is quite difficult to find a house if it's not the 1st of July :sweat_smile: I guess it's not the same in Vancouver but it's just to make you understand the "any" word!

Not sure what time is there, have a good day!

Vancouver is a pretty expensive city to live in compared to Montreal but finding a place to live doesn't take too long.
Montreal can get pretty expensive too when you get closer to downtown. The average for a 1 bedroom apartment in Vancouver is 1600/Month, downtown Montreal is 1200/Month.
Montreal does have a "moving season" but there are always a lot of places to go if you look well enough
Do you have any studios you want to join in particular?
